summary: This document is a series of email exchanges from November-December 2021 between a DOJ OIG Senior Special Agent and an Associate Warden regarding scheduling an interview. The interview is part of an OIG investigation concerning an incident at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on August 10, 2019. The correspondence involves logistical coordination for the interview, including location, time, and the provision of a voluntary interview form.

persons.name: Associate Warden Forrest
persons.context: The recipient of the interview request from the DOJ OIG. They were transferred from MCC New York to a facility in Arkansas (AR) and are being asked to discuss documentation gathered after an August 10, 2019, incident at the MCC.

persons.name: SSA
persons.role: Senior Special Agent, U.S. Department of Justice OIG
persons.context: The DOJ OIG agent from the Boston Area Office who is initiating the investigation and scheduling an interview with Associate Warden Forrest regarding the August 2019 MCC incident.

connections.description: The SSA is conducting an OIG investigation and is requesting an interview with Associate Warden Forrest, who possesses relevant documentation from the MCC incident.

events.title: Incident at MCC

events.title: Scheduled OIG Interview
events.description: A telephone interview was scheduled between the DOJ OIG SSA and Associate Warden Forrest at 10:30 AM Eastern Time as part of the investigation into the 2019 MCC incident.

keyFacts: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General (OIG) was actively investigating an incident that occurred at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on August 10, 2019, as of late 2021.
Associate Warden Forrest, who was at MCC New York at the time of the 2019 incident, had been transferred to a facility in Arkansas by September 2021.
The OIG agent sought to interview Associate Warden Forrest specifically about documentation they gathered immediately following the August 2019 incident.
The correspondence confirms the interview was voluntary, as the OIG required a form to be signed acknowledging this at the start of the interview.
The logistical emails show coordination across time zones (Eastern vs. Central) and debate over an in-person visit versus a telephone interview due to the associate warden's location in Arkansas.
